thread.title_full: Kangana Ranaut: Saif Ali Khan is funny, he works with ease and Shahid Kapoor is competitive, both are awesome

title: Kangana Ranaut: Saif Ali Khan is funny, he works with ease and Shahid Kapoor is competitive, both are awesome
text: Kangana Ranaut: Saif Ali Khan is funny, he works with ease and Shahid Kapoor is competitive, both are awesome Rohan Valecha Kangana Ranaut who plays the feisty Miss Julia in Vishal Bhardwaj’s film ‘Rangoon’ can’t wait for the calendar to go straight to February 24. | TNN | Feb 16, 2017, 03.10 PM IST Kangana Ranaut who plays the feisty Miss Julia in Vishal Bhardwaj 's film 'Rangoon' can't wait for the calendar to go straight to February 24. 'Rangoon' is a love triangle set against the backdrop of World War II. It releases the weekend after and Kangana is busy promoting her labour of love at TV shows and film studios, giving interviews to the media and speaking about the magic of 'Rangoon'. "It's an unusual film. The scale, the backdrop and the theme of the film is extraordinary. It's not one of those films that are shot over 60 days and at safe locations - a house, a taxi. 'Rangoon' is a big scale film, it takes a director who has guts to take on a project like this," says the actress who is courting Saif Ali Khan and Shahid Kapoor in the film. Ask her about the men and their style of working and she is quick to point out that "Saif is funny, he makes you feel comfortable, he works with ease but Shahid is competitive and he rehearses a lot. He ensures everyone is in sync. But both are amazing." Kangana Ranaut gets a pixie cut for 'Rangoon' Kangana Ranaut 's next film Rangoon is with Vishal Bhardwaj and it will go on floors in October. One hears that the actress will flaunt a pixie cut in the film She plays superstar Miss Julia in the film, a feisty actress from the 1940s, who has men at her beck and call, she's a go getter and a firebrand. "Today's girls can relate to Miss Julia, even though the character is set in the 1940s." 'Rangoon' is Kangana's first film with director Vishal Bhardwaj. Shahid and Saif have worked with the filmmaker earlier in 'Kaminey', 'Haider' and 'Omkara'. Stay updated on the go with Times of India News App. Click here to download it for your device. RELATED
